intro: Oncoba paraensis, commonly known as the Para Oncoba, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil. Oncoba paraensis plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing nectar for pollinators.
